NAICS72_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.
NAICS72_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS56_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.
NAICS56_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS11_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.
NAICS11_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS71_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.
NAICS71_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS23_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.
NAICS23_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS61_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Educational Services
NAICS61_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.
NAICS61_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS52_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.
NAICS52_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS62_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.
NAICS62_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS51_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.
NAICS51_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS55_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.
NAICS55_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS31_33_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.
NAICS31_33_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS21_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.
NAICS21_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS92_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.
NAICS92_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS53_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing

NAICS53_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.
NAICS53_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS44_45_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.
NAICS44_45_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS48_49_entry_rate.short_name: Entry Rate in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_entry_rate.long_name: Entry Rate in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.
NAICS48_49_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS22_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.
NAICS22_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS42_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.
NAICS42_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

NAICS48_49_exit_rate.long_name: Exit Rate in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_exit_rate.short_description: Businesses exit rate in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stopped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

NAICS22_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stopped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

NAICS42_exit_rate.short_description: Businesses exit rate in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stopped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.

NAICS72_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.

NAICS56_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.

NAICS11_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.

NAICS71_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.

NAICS23_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.

NAICS61_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

NAICS52_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

NAICS62_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

NAICS51_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

NAICS55_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

NAICS31_33_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

NAICS21_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

NAICS99_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Nonclassifiable Establishments. \href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=99&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 99}.

NAICS81_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Other Services (except Public Administration). The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.

NAICS54_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.

NAICS92_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.

NAICS53_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

NAICS44_45_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.

These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.

NAICS11_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.

NAICS71_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.

NAICS23_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.

NAICS61_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

NAICS52_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

NAICS62_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

NAICS51_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

NAICS55_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

NAICS31_33_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

NAICS21_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

NAICS99_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Nonclassifiable Establishments. \href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=99&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 99}.

NAICS81_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Other Services (except Public Administration). The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.

NAICS54_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.

NAICS92_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.

NAICS53_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

NAICS44_45_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.

NAICS48_49_number_business.short_name: Total Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_number_business.long_name: Total Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_number_business.short_description: Total businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

NAICS22_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

NAICS42_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.

NAICS72_small_business.short_name: Small Businesses in Accommodation and Food Services

NAICS72_small_business.short_description: Small businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_small_business.long_description: Count of small businesses. in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.

NAICS55_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

NAICS31_33_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

NAICS21_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

NAICS99_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Nonclassifiable Establishments. \href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=99&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 99}.

NAICS81_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Other Services (except Public Administration). The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.

NAICS54_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.

NAICS92_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.

NAICS53_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

NAICS44_45_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.

NAICS48_49_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

NAICS22_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

NAICS42_soloproprio_business.short_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_soloproprio_business.long_name: Sole Proprietor Businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_soloproprio_business.short_description: Sole proprietor businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.

NAICS72_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.

NAICS56_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.

NAICS11_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.

NAICS71_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.

NAICS23_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Construction
NAICS23_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Construction
NAICS23_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Construction
NAICS23_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.

NAICS61_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Educational Services
NAICS61_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Educational Services
NAICS61_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Educational Services
NAICS61_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

NAICS52_perc_small.short_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_perc_small.long_name: Percentage of Small Businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

NAICS62_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

NAICS51_perc_small.short_description: percent of small businesses in Information
NAICS51_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

NAICS62_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.
NAICS62_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS51_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Information
NAICS51_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Information
NAICS51_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Information
NAICS51_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.
NAICS51_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS55_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.
NAICS55_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS31_33_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.
NAICS31_33_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS21_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.
NAICS21_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS99_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Nonclassifiable Establishments. \href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=99&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 99}.
NAICS99_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS81_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Other Services (except Public Administration). The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.
NAICS81_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS54_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.
NAICS54_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS92_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.
NAICS92_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS53_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.
NAICS53_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS44_45_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.
NAICS44_45_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS48_49_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.
NAICS48_49_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS22_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.
NAICS22_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS42_perc_soloproprio.short_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_perc_soloproprio.long_name: Percentage of Sole Proprietor Businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_perc_soloproprio.short_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.
NAICS42_perc_soloproprio.statement: {value} percent of sole proprietor businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS72_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Accommodation and Food Services industry
NAICS72_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS72 industry. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS56_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services industry
NAICS56_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS56 industry. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS11_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting industry
NAICS11_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS11 industry. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS71_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation industry
NAICS71_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS71 industry. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS23_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Construction
NAICS23_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS23 industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS61_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Educational Services industry
NAICS61_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Educational Services
NAICS61_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS61 industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS52_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Finance and Insurance industry
NAICS52_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS52 industry. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS62_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS62 industry. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.. Available for US businesses.
