NAICS31_33_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS31_33 industry. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS21_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry
NAICS21_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS21 industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS99_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Nonclassifiable Establishments industry
NAICS99_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Nonclassifiable Establishments
NAICS99_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS99 industry. \href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=99&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 99}. . Available for US businesses.

NAICS81_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Other Services (except Public Administration) industry
NAICS81_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Other Services (except Public Administration)
NAICS81_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS81 industry. The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS54_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services industry
NAICS54_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS54 industry. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS92_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Public Administration industry
NAICS92_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS92 industry. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS53_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing industry
NAICS53_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS53 industry. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS44_45_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Retail Trade industry
NAICS44_45_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS44_45 industry. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS48_49_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Transportation and Warehousing industry
NAICS48_49_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS48_49 industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS22_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS42_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Wholesale Trade industry
NAICS42_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in NAICS42 industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS72_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Accommodation and Food Services industry
NAICS72_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS72 industry. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS56_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services industry
NAICS56_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS56 industry. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS11_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting industry
NAICS11_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS11 industry. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS71_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation industry
NAICS71_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS71 industry. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS23_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Construction industry
NAICS23_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Construction
NAICS23_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS23 industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS61_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Educational Services
NAICS61_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Educational Services industry
NAICS61_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Educational Services
NAICS61_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS61 industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS52_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Finance and Insurance industry
NAICS52_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS52 industry. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS62_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance industry
NAICS62_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS62 industry. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS51_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Information industry
NAICS51_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Information
NAICS51_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS51 industry. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS55_business_create_job.short_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_business_create_job.long_name: Businesses Creating Jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry
NAICS55_business_create_job.short_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_business_create_job.long_description: Total businesses creating new jobs in NAICS55 industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. Available for US businesses.

The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS51_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS55_job_creation_active.short_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_job_creation_active.long_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry
NAICS55_job_creation_active.short_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS55 industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS55_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS31_33_job_creation_active.long_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Manufacturing industry
NAICS31_33_job_creation_active.short_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS31_33 industry. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS31_33_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS21_job_creation_active.short_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction

NAICS21_job_creation_active.short_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS21 industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS21_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS48_49_job_creation_active.short_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Transportation and Warehousing

NAICS48_49_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS48_49 industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS48_49_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS22_job_creation_active.short_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_job_creation_active.long_name: Jobs Created by Active Businesses in Utilities industry
NAICS22_job_creation_active.short_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS22_job_creation_active.statement: {value} new jobs created by active businesses in {region_name}.

The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.

The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS22_job_creation_new.long_name: Jobs Created by New Businesses in Utilities industry

NAICS22_job_creation_new.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS23_perc_job_creation_new.short_description: Job creation rate by new businesses in Construction
NAICS23_perc_job_creation_new.long_description: Percent of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[perc\_job\_creation\_new=\frac{job\_created\_by\_new\_businesses}{all\_jobs\_created}\] in NAICS23 industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS23_perc_job_creation_new.statement: {value} percent of new jobs created by new businesses in {region_name}.

The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS61_perc_job_creation_new.statement: {value} percent of new jobs created by new businesses in {region_name}.

The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS81_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS81 industry. The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS81_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS54_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services industry
NAICS54_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
NAICS54_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS54 industry. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS54_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS92_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Public Administration
NAICS92_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Public Administration industry
NAICS92_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Public Administration
NAICS92_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS92 industry. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS92_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS53_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing industry
NAICS53_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
NAICS53_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS53 industry. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS53_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS44_45_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Retail Trade industry
NAICS44_45_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Retail Trade
NAICS44_45_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS44_45 industry. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS44_45_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS48_49_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Transportation and Warehousing industry
NAICS48_49_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Transportation and Warehousing
NAICS48_49_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS48_49 industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS48_49_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS22_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Utilities industry
NAICS22_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Utilities
NAICS22_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS22_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS42_total_job_creation.short_name: Total Jobs Created in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_total_job_creation.long_name: Total Jobs Created in Wholesale Trade industry
NAICS42_total_job_creation.short_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_total_job_creation.long_description: Total new jobs created by businesses in NAICS42 industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS42_total_job_creation.statement: {value} new jobs created by businesses in {region_name}.

NAICS72_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Accommodation and Food Services industry
NAICS72_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Accommodation and Food Services
NAICS72_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS72 industry. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS56_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services industry
NAICS56_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services
NAICS56_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS56 industry. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS11_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting industry
NAICS11_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
NAICS11_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS11 industry. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS71_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation industry
NAICS71_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
NAICS71_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS71 industry. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS23_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Construction industry
NAICS23_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Construction
NAICS23_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS23 industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS61_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Educational Services
NAICS61_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Educational Services industry
NAICS61_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Educational Services
NAICS61_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS61 industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS52_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Finance and Insurance industry
NAICS52_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Finance and Insurance
NAICS52_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS52 industry. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS62_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance industry
NAICS62_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Health Care and Social Assistance
NAICS62_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS62 industry. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS51_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Information industry
NAICS51_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Information
NAICS51_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS51 industry. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS55_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry
NAICS55_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Management of Companies and Enterprises
NAICS55_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS55 industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS31_33_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Manufacturing industry
NAICS31_33_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Manufacturing
NAICS31_33_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS31_33 industry. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Available for US businesses.

NAICS21_business_destruction_job.short_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_business_destruction_job.long_name: Businesses Eliminating Jobs in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry
NAICS21_business_destruction_job.short_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction
NAICS21_business_destruction_job.long_description: Count of businesses industry cutting jobs in NAICS21 industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.

The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. NAICS22_job_destruction_active.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. NAICS22_Location_quotient.long_description: Ratio of industry employment share from an area relative to the county: \[Location\_quotient=\frac{industry\_employment\_share_geography}{industry\_employment\_share_county}\] in NAICS22 industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS22_Location_quotient.statement: The NAICS22 industry has {value} more employment share in {region_name} relative to the county.

NAICS42_Location_quotient.long_name: Location  Quotient in Wholesale Trade industry
NAICS42_Location_quotient.short_description: ratio of industry employment share in Wholesale Trade
NAICS42_Location_quotient.long_description: Ratio of industry employment share from an area relative to the county: \[Location\_quotient=\frac{industry\_employment\_share_geography}{industry\_employment\_share_county}\] in NAICS42 industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.
NAICS42_Location_quotient.statement: The NAICS42 industry has {value} more employment share in {region_name} relative to the county.

The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. minority_owned_business_create_job.long_name: Count of businesses creating new jobs as minority-owned
minority_owned_business_create_job.short_description: Count of businesses creating new jobs as minority-owned
minority_owned_business_create_job.long_description: Count of businesses creating new jobs as minority-owned. A minority-owned business is a U.S. business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group, namely U.S. citizens who are African Americans (Black), Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, Asian-Pacific Americans and Sub-Continent Asian Americans. Available for US businesses.

Available for US businesses.
